reviews.content: After many disappointing Glenmorangies with fancy names, experimental cask finishes and no age statements I was happy to find this one very satisfying."Extremely Rare" is an exageration, it's an easy drinking basic sherry finish with a price tag not too inflated.
reviews.nose: Pleasant and inviting.Honey sweet with a subtle sherry caracter.Oranges, an apple, chocolate shavings.
reviews.taste: Just about what you expect from the nose.Sweet honey and vanilla arrival.Oranges and a little spice comes along nicely.Quite bright fruityness, apricot, pears?
reviews.finish: Medium lenght.Some chocolate and nuts.

reviews.nose: Peach, ripe banana, strawberry, yellow raisin, honey, caramel and vanilla. Eventually a little nutmeg.
reviews.taste: Apricot, banana, caramel, vanilla, honey and nuts.
reviews.finish: Caramel, banana, plum, vanilla, apple and peanut.

reviews.content: Delicious fruity whisky, surprisingly full taste for 'only' 43% Abv.
reviews.nose: Fruity! Tropical fruits, pineapple, banana. Citrus too. And now also clear vanilla sweetness. And floral. A lot of smell. Now also what Dreft. And mango, orange juice
reviews.taste: Fruity, slightly tingling / peppery, citrus, orange (zest). Sweet, honey, peach, tropical fruits again.
reviews.finish: Also some clear bitterness now, grapefruit. Also sweet, peach and honey. Pretty long finish. Light pepper still.

reviews.content: Nose:- Perfumed olorosso sherry and pickled young mango, boiled mixed spices and peppery pungent, nose heating and bold. Palate:- Creamy pear and peach syrup, mature sherry flavours whirl around ripe plum, vanilla and clove.  Elegant and full of authority. Double cask at its best. Finish:- Long and chewy. Sweet dates and intense. Warming. Clear cut and forward character, easy to understand. — at The Whisky Bar, Kuala Lumpur.

Very tasty, definitely not a sherry bomb, the Oloroso has problems on all levels with the ex-bourbon influence to create some space, but if he can do that, then it is a good addition. Otherwise, I really like the basic tangerine tone.
reviews.nose: Very fruity, apple, malt, strawberry, vanilla, some acid, citrus, tangerine, sweet, with spice, slightly leathery, almonds, after some time in the glass it becomes creamier and there is also some grated dark chocolate, but the ex-bourbon influence dominates in my opinion in the nose, but time brings the sherry a bit forward, now something like grape-nut-chocolate
reviews.taste: sweet, fruity, tangerine, creamy, vanilla, good start, intense, juicy, some salt, now bittersweet on the palate, with the second sip I find some oloroso, liquorice, raisins in the start, but then it gets a good deal of the tangerine again suppressed, good mouthfeel, even if it does not appear quite as viscous
reviews.finish: almost as if you had drunk the mandarin juice out of the can, sweet, slightly tart, fruit bowl, very slightly hinted at some oak on the tongue

reviews.content: N: That ‘light’ presentation is the distillery profile as far as I’m concerned, almost fluffy (a la Balvenie double wood) especially in the 12yo, but with more elegance that comes with maturity at 18 years. Malty cereals, oranges and lemons (dry enough), a malty sour note. Really has all the major corners covered.T: Continues along similar lines. Reminiscent almost of those 1950's oily out-turns, but mainly suggestive. Really malty, quite sweet with a touch of sour and a little salty .F: ,… then a little pepper, really just a sprinkle with many vanilla waves and dry [vanillin] oak. Tasty casks.C: Yeah, good stuff, Glenmorangie really have consistency down. The strength is a real factor though, but golly this is good. Then again I've had cask strength versions of low powered core-range-malts that loose more than they gain from that extra abv boost. I see this is the third time I’ve scored the 18yo the same mark - there’s me showing some consistency too, who’d have thought?Scores a B
Straw color. Rare structure.
reviews.nose: Sweet and sour aromas. Ripe fruit. Oranges, peaches. Ripe apples. Caramel, vanilla. Cream, sweet cream.
reviews.taste: Cream. A delicate barrel. Dark chocolate. Spices. Cinnamon. Light oily.
reviews.finish: Dessert chocolate. Cinnamon. Cocoa. Medium-long finish.

reviews.nose: Villa, sweet, honey,
reviews.taste: sweet fruits, honey, its really sweet and pleasant,
reviews.finish: not much going on im afraid, although some spices and honey is still there.

reviews.content: So this is either a case of batch variation or of some serious oxidization. I've had this one before and remember it as much "darker" and more Oloroso-influenced. The sample I'm working with here is considerably brighter, fruitier, and lighter.Still very solid, though, and the only core-range Glenmo I'd consider buying again.UPDATE: Having recently opened a bottle of my own, my suspicion is confirmed: the sample I had was a bit weak (perhaps from the last third of an open bottle, something like that). This is much better - darker, stronger, more to the point - and I'm raising my overall score from 84 to 86.
reviews.nose: Grassy, floral, fruity. Pineapple, peaches and hay. Marzipan, white chocolate, vanilla. Seems younger than 18 initially. But wait: after some time, the wood begins to make its presence felt on the nose as well. Really hits its stride once it has wet the gullet. After the first sips, a herbal / spicy component kicks in that is highly reminiscent of some good-quality European-oak ex-sherry casks.
reviews.taste: Ah, here's where the age comes through. Immediate oak presence with creamy tannins and a good body for the strength. Plenty of Oloroso / umami flavors. Sweet, spicy and luscious, with enough substance to serve as an after-dinner dram. The Glenmo fruits are present, but they're counterbalanced by a nicely measured tannic bitterness. There may be some (small measure of) European oak in here after all.
reviews.finish: Medium length, with a nice, slow fade, mainly on fruit and pepper. Seems more like 46 than 43 percent, which doesn't happen to often. A bit fizzy, with acidity and bitterness playing off each other. The sweetness recedes quite a bit at this point. Nothing crazy special, but also nothing unpleasant.

reviews.content: Very pleasing, round and noble standard

reviews.taste: Sherry with citrus, floral, malt, spice of cinnamon / nutmeg, in the back dates, figs, some oak but everything very round and drinkable, typical Glenmorangie
reviews.finish: Mitellang, nut, citrus, dry

reviews.finish: A little spice, vanilla, fresh apples, white fruits, apricots. Creamy and really sweet. Floral honey again, orange blossom, ice cream, barley sugar, a little oak. Hints of lemon, some gentle citrus. Good length. Nice.

Lots of citrus, orange peel and honey sweetness, dried apricots and a hint of ecotic fruit and spices, the finish shows next to some Nimm2 fruitiness and sweetness especially the oak. Since the 18 years Fassreifung are properly present.  Great taste and nice wood on the finish, but seems a bit too styled.  I'm surprised - I think it's really alright even if it was obviously created as a pleasing malt for the masses.

reviews.content: incredible sweet and fruity, honey, vanilla and some spices too. what a wonderful dram. just nice to get an older glenmorangie without fancy cask finishes - allthough I do love them as well.

"Producer`s Tasting NotesAroma: The cornucopia of an autumn harvest festival table describes the overflowing abundance of arresting aromas that tantalise at the first nose of Glenmorangie 18 Years Old. The rich, resinous quality of nuts cascades into a crisp toffee sweetness of crème brulée, merging with caressingly smooth, creamy vanilla. Hints of vibrant oranges & lemons are found. Crunchy textured walnuts follow, oozing into golden honeycomb that trickles over sun-ripened sticky dates. Then sparkling floral tones emerge, taking the edge off any cloying sweetness, with the green, almost herbal bouquet of geranium, tempered with musky jasmine and the bright, sharp clarity of narcissus.With water, 18 Years Old reveals a rich oaken, balsamic character that yields to soft vanilla. At this moment, the signature Glenmorangie fruity complex reveals itself in golden apricots and dates mingled with hazelnuts. Taste: Glenmorangie 18 Years Old slips like silk over the tongue with a full, rounded flavour, starting with grapefruit & orange. The palate is then entranced with an accord of melting honey, creamy malt and aromatic florals that segue into the warm, syrupy nuttiness of hazelnuts and walnuts from the Oloroso sherry casks in which the whisky is matured. Savour the rich, sticky date and fig flavours as they are heightened by the unexpected caress of woodsmoke. Finish: Lingering and enticing with the subtle sweetness of dried fruit and the nutty dryness of sherry."TWE

reviews.taste: Slightly sweet, spicy, pungy/stimulating and liquorice wood (reduced: slightly floral with mediterinian spices).
reviews.finish: Dry, warm with some herbal tea.

reviews.taste: Honey, vanilla, nuts, a bit dry, some spices.
reviews.finish: Short to medium. Oak and spices.

reviews.content: A wonderfully fresh light whisky. Not too complex and the sherry ripening brings the fruity dark component.  He is worth his money.
reviews.nose: Sweet pleasantly soft nose, light peach and citrus notes, lemon balm,  Transition into a freshly smelling summer meadow, hints of marzipan
reviews.taste: Fruity sweet, apple, cherries,  Followed by floral notes, slightly spicy at the back with slight bitter notes, almonds,  Well balanced, alcohol almost too little.
reviews.finish: Medium long, first fruit, apples becomes less subtle sherry sweetness penetrates, drier towards the end, oak with some vanilla

Rich honey and milk chocolate sweetness follow, brightened by crisp apple and pear freshness. On the palate, vanilla is joined by the fruit sweetness of apple and pear, creating a delightful balance.

03/03/2024 - 30 ml. A good typical ex-bourbon, but after being revealed in the blind test it proved to be terrible value for money, as, despite having no alcohol and being round, it is just an expensive ex-bourbon. But I'm glad I had the opportunity to meet you.
reviews.nose: Vanilla, fresh fruit, white chocolate; a little spicy, but like a Syrian pepper. Sugar, new wood and malt. Slightly citrusy, like lemonide. With water: eliminated the remaining alcohol, increased the vanilla and sugar. Honey. Citric, but without being acidic.
reviews.taste: White sugar, pineapple, non-aggressive alcohol, lime orange, vanilla and new white wood. That's it with water, a good fruity and sugary ex-bourbon, with notes of new wood from the barrel.
reviews.finish: Average, pleasant, without any major surprises, but a typical round and sweet ex-bourbon, with good barrel wood.

reviews.content: After the Glenmorangie 18 with me now for a long time, yes I admit it, a little disdained and dusty standing around in the corner, but now has settled in the leftovers something like old botttle flavor. The nose is now clearer, nuttier and more complex compared to previous years. The cereal notes are dominant, but are accompanied by quite pleasant dried fruits and floral scent. In the mouth, however, quickly dominates the boring oak dryness, which is why I'm not warm with this whisky and unfortunately will not. Here I lack fruit, spice and complexity. The finish is short and dry. Ordinary standard paint.

Dried fruits, spices, oak cask, floral, fresh grass, apples, vanilla, toffee, cream and honey notes on nose.Caramel, fruits, apples, oak, cream, toffee and honey notes on taste.Long finish with spices, vanilla, oak, a little bit ginger notes.Sweet and easy to drink whisky.
Great whisky, very smooth and with excellent balance. Not very complex but highly enjoyable even without that. The cost of 70-80 euros makes it one of the best purchases in this price category.
reviews.nose: Mild, floral, a bit perfumery, honey, red apples, pear, nougat, vanilla, light sherry notes, yellow plums, sweet oranges
reviews.taste: Spicy (peppers and cinnamon), dried fruits, walnuts, butter, oranges and grapefruit (bitter notes), canned pineapple, figs, slightly drying oak at the end
reviews.finish: Medium-long, nutty, floral notes, dried pears, hint of white pepper

reviews.content: Fruity and smooth. Responds very well to a couple of drops of water and being left in the glass for a short while before sampling.
More on: https://tomtrinkt.blog/
reviews.nose: Very vanilla, forest honey, slightly flowery, red apples, oranges and dark fruits thanks to the partial sherry cask maturation. Then a bit nuttier and spicier with fine oak notes. An alcoholic note is imperceptible.
reviews.taste: Very oily / creamy, honey sweet, crème brûlée, fine sherry notes, dates, raisins and oranges. The nuttiness and spice increase noticeably and form a nice contrast to the initial sweetness, without becoming too dominant. The whisky has an absolutely harmonious, complex and well-balanced overall picture. Almost dangerously tasty with 43% by volume!
reviews.finish: Medium to long, some honey, still pleasantly nutty, spicy and slightly drier. The fine sherry aromas are gradually leaving. Some bittersweet chocolate.

reviews.content: This tasting sample is from the version bottled on September 5, 2018. It performed very well for a daily diet, but unfortunately it's discontinued. It's unclear whether the new packaging will maintain this level of quality. Also, it might not be very breathable, and it might not be suitable for sipping too much. Rating reference price: CNY 500
reviews.nose: The aroma is quite expansive, but carries a slightly undeniable alcohol note. It's a blend of corn, popcorn, banana, cream, and small amounts of dried lime, cinnamon, nutmeg, pepper, and a trace of dried chili. However, all the aromas have a subtle, unnatural quality and aren't particularly strong, so while the alcohol note is weak, it's not overwhelming either.
reviews.taste: The alcohol content is well-controlled. The fruit flavors are rich and juicy, a blend of apple, orange, cherry, yellow peach, mulberry, and grape juice, mixed with toffee and a touch of tannins. In the mid-to-late stages, there are distinct warm mixed spices, mulled wine, and a hint of sweet stewing. It is very smooth and easy to drink, but the flavor is not overpowering.
reviews.finish: A touch of candied fruit with peel and chocolate, with dry woody notes and some tannins. Almost no bitterness. On the weaker side, with a moderate length. Slightly burning sensation in the stomach.

reviews.nose: Delicate with notes of sherry, floral, notes of lavender, yellow mirabelle plums, some ripe fruit (mainly apples), prunes, orange peel, raisins, vanilla, honey, a pinch of spices and dried herbs, dried fruit, old dry oak in the background
reviews.taste: Smooth and sweet after a while there are wine notes with a pinch of white pepper, creamy and buttery with lemon zest, a little floral, ripe oranges, prunes, dark chocolate, vanilla, honey, spices, dried herbs, a handful of nuts, oak bitterness
reviews.finish: Long, oak bitterness with spices, a handful of nuts, bitter chocolate at the end

reviews.content: Lovely nose, a fruity , peaches , barley sugar, apricot, oranges, touch of spice. An easy sipper. Quality mature gentle dram.

reviews.nose: Orange, peach, floral. A very light scent ..
reviews.taste: Soft, sweet, layered and balanced. Especially tangerine, but also peach and apricot. Floral (lavender?) And wood.

reviews.content: Reminiscent reminiscent of Old Pulteney, but missing here as I said the fruit. A pity ..
reviews.nose: Sweet vanilla cream, creme brulee and pickled orange fillets, as well as mango from the tin. These are joined by mild nuts, such as almonds and hazelnuts, possibly greasy macadamia. Flowery-fresh tea with tender hay.
reviews.taste: comparatively dry, much drier at least than the 10-year-old and the three wine finishes. Less fruit, more nuts, more spice. Cinnamon and pepper, but also lemony-spicy ginger and chilli powder (which does not quite suit my picture of Glenmorangie).
reviews.finish: Dry, warm wood, tart sencha tea and spicy-dark caramel.

reviews.nose: Sweet and fragrant.Fruits such as apples or pears, bright flowers, and cinnamon.
reviews.taste: Lighter than expected.Honey mixed with water, cinnamon, chocolate, vanilla and spice.Leans more toward the bitter & spicy, rather than the sweet side.
reviews.finish: Subtle yet fairly long finish. Dark chocolate and almonds. Powdery and bitter.

reviews.taste: The taste is fairly short, but extremely smooth. Oak, lemon, vanilla and a hint of spice fill your mouth.
reviews.finish: The finishis quite long with wood tones that emerge, supported by the bitter taste of chocolate and a hint of honey.

reviews.content: The 18 year old from Glenmorangie is very easy to drink and pleases as a beautiful mature malt that can be a nice companion on a summer day / evening. The sweet-fruity base with this nice cake association is appealing. He can't deny his kinship with the 10y. He doesn't have to either. You can clearly see his longer ripening time. For the current price of an average of less than € 90, you can already put a bottle on the shelf.
reviews.nose: Sweet vanilla aromas with ripe yellow apples are immediately present in the nose. There are also other fruits such as mango and fully ripe dark grapefruit. You can also see malt or even light dough. The whole scented pourri is compressed into a light fruit cake. The alcohol is well integrated. The 43% have little to no sharp presence.
reviews.taste: The sweet fruit cake with vanilla sauce develops into a creamy mouthfeel. Roasted almond chips also stick to the dough. After the fruit / malt mix, it becomes slightly spicy and strong in the mouth. The aromatic oak begins to show towards the finish.
reviews.finish: The wood on tap is clear, but not really strong. Not very bitter, rather nutty, like hazelnut or maybe even a hint of walnut. The finish is medium long. The malt moves down nicely warming. In the end, fruit aromas pop out again briefly.

reviews.content: Overall quite well balance with fruity notes but quite some bitterness at the end.
reviews.nose: Sweet honey, vanilla powder, good amount of orange concentrate, fruity, some fresh wood, malty
reviews.taste: Sweet lemon, fruity, grapefruit (bitterness), some dusty notes, some salt
reviews.finish: Medium long, with grapefruit lingers
